41 void terminateOnError();
42 
51 class Error : public std::exception
52 {
53 public:
54 
61  Error(const std::string& type) :
62  m_type(type),
63  m_extra_info(),
64  m_formatted_message()
65  {
66  // Set this Error as the most recent
67  lastError() = this;
68  errorCount()++;
69 
70  // The first Error object created needs to save the current terminate
71  // handler
72  if (errorCount() == 1)
73  terminateHandler() = std::set_terminate(terminateOnError);
74 
75  formatMessage();
76  }
77 
83  Error(const Error& copy) :
84  m_type(copy.m_type),
85  m_extra_info(copy.m_extra_info),
86  m_formatted_message(copy.m_formatted_message)
87  {
88  m_message_stream << copy.m_message_stream.rdbuf();
89 
90  // Set this Error as the most recent
91  lastError() = this;
92  errorCount()++;
93  }
94 
96  virtual ~Error() throw()
97  {
98  // Reset the terminate function
99  errorCount()--;
100  if (errorCount() == 0)
101  std::set_terminate(terminateHandler());
102  }
103 
105  template <typename T>
106  Error& operator<< (const T& in)
107  {
108  m_message_stream << in;
109  formatMessage();
110  return *this;
111  }
112 
126  virtual const char* what() const throw() {
127  return m_formatted_message.c_str();
128  }
129 
140  template <typename T>
141  void addExtraInfo(const std::string& name, const T& value)
142  {
143  // This should be safe, any type T that isn't supported by the <<
144  // operator should cause a compilation error.
145  try {
146  std::stringstream ss;
147  ss << value;
148  m_extra_info.push_back(make_pair(name, ss.str()));
149  formatMessage();
150  } catch (std::exception&) {
151  // In the unlikely event this throws an exception, just ignore the
152  // extra info. It is better to protect this exception and get some
153  // error message, then to get a message about what happened here.
154  }
155  }
156 
158  template <typename T>
159  Error& operator()(const std::string& name, const T& value) {
160  addExtraInfo(name, value);
161  return *this;
162  }
163 
170  const std::string& getExtraInfo(const std::string& name) const
171  {
172  // This should be safe from exceptions.
173  std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string> >::const_iterator it;
174  for (it = m_extra_info.begin(); it != m_extra_info.end(); ++it)
175  if (it->first == name) return it->second;
176 
177  // Could throw, but there is nothing we could really do because we have
178  // to return something. It is very very unlikely this would throw.
179  static std::string empty;
180  return empty;
181  }
182 
183  // Give private access to terminate function
184  friend void terminateOnError();
185 
186 private:
187 
201  void formatMessage()
202  {
203  m_formatted_message = "\nM++ error: " + m_type + ".\n";
204 
205  std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string> >::iterator it;
206  for (it = m_extra_info.begin(); it != m_extra_info.end(); ++it)
207  m_formatted_message += it->first + ": " + it->second + "\n";
208 
209  m_formatted_message += m_message_stream.str() + "\n";
210  }
211 
213  static Error*& lastError() {
214  static Error* p_last_error = NULL;
215  return p_last_error;
216  }
217 
219  static int& errorCount() {
220  static int count = 0;
221  return count;
222  }
223 
225  static std::terminate_handler& terminateHandler() {
226  static std::terminate_handler handler;
227  return handler;
228  }
229 
230 private:
231 
233  std::string m_type;
234 
236  std::stringstream m_message_stream;
237 
239  std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string> > m_extra_info;
240 
242  std::string m_formatted_message;
243 
244 }; // class Error
245 
246 
250 inline void terminateOnError()
251 {
252  // Notify the user of the last error.
253  std::cout << Error::lastError()->what() << std::endl;
254 
255  // Try to clean up before terminating
256  std::exit(1);
257 }
258 
259 
275 template <typename ConcreteType>
276 class ErrorExtension : public Error
277 {
278 public:
279 
281  virtual ~ErrorExtension() throw() { }
282 
284  template <typename T>
285  ConcreteType& operator<< (const T& in)
286  {
287  Error::operator<<(in);
288  return static_cast<ConcreteType&>(*this);
289  }
290 
292  template <typename T>
293  ConcreteType& operator()(const std::string& name, const T& value) {
294  Error::addExtraInfo(name, value);
295  return static_cast<ConcreteType&>(*this);
296  }
297 
298 protected:
299 
301  ErrorExtension(const std::string& type) :
302  Error(type)
303  { }
304 };
305 
306 
308 class FileNotFoundError : public ErrorExtension<FileNotFoundError>
309 {
310 public:
312  FileNotFoundError(const std::string& file) :
313  ErrorExtension<FileNotFoundError>("file not found")
314  {
315  addExtraInfo("file", file);
316  }
317 
319  const std::string& file() const {
320  return getExtraInfo("file");
321  }
322 }; // class FileNotFoundError
323 
324 
326 class FileParseError : public ErrorExtension<FileParseError>
327 {
328 public:
330  FileParseError(const std::string& file, int line) :
331  ErrorExtension<FileParseError>("error parsing file")
332  {
333  addExtraInfo("file", file);
334  addExtraInfo("line", line);
335  }
336 
338  const std::string& file() const {
339  return getExtraInfo("file");
340  }
341 
343  const std::string& line() const {
344  return getExtraInfo("line");
345  }
346 }; // class FileParseError
347 
348 
350 class InvalidInputError : public ErrorExtension<InvalidInputError>
351 {
352 public:
354  template <typename T>
355  InvalidInputError(const std::string& name, const T& value) :
356  ErrorExtension<InvalidInputError>("invalid input"),
357  m_name(name)
358  {
359  std::stringstream ss; ss << value;
360  m_value = ss.str();
361  addExtraInfo("input", m_name + " = " + m_value);
362  }
363 
365  ~InvalidInputError() throw() { }
366 
368  const std::string& inputName() const {
369  return m_name;
370  }
371 
373  const std::string& inputValue() const {
374  return m_value;
375  }
376 private:
377  std::string m_name;
378  std::string m_value;
379 }; // class InvalidInput
380 
381 
387 class LogicError : public ErrorExtension<LogicError>
388 {
389 public:
390  LogicError(const char* file, int line) :
391  ErrorExtension<LogicError>("logic error")
392  {
393  addExtraInfo("file", file);
394  addExtraInfo("line", line);
395  }
396 
398  const std::string& file() const {
399  return getExtraInfo("file");
400  }
401 
403  const std::string& line() const {
404  return getExtraInfo("line");
405  }
406 }; // class LogicError
407 
408 #define LogicError() LogicError(__FILE__, __LINE__)
409 
410 
413 class NotImplementedError : public ErrorExtension<NotImplementedError>
414 {
415 public:
416  NotImplementedError(const char* func, const char* file, int line) :
417  ErrorExtension<NotImplementedError>("function not implemented")
418  {
419  addExtraInfo("function", func);
420  addExtraInfo("file", file);
421  addExtraInfo("line", line);
422  }
423 
425  const std::string& file() const {
426  return getExtraInfo("file");
427  }
428 
430  const std::string& function() const {
431  return getExtraInfo("function");
432  }
433 
435  const std::string& line() const {
436  return getExtraInfo("line");
437  }
438 };
439 
441 class MissingDataError : public ErrorExtension<MissingDataError>
442 {
443 public:
444  MissingDataError() :
445  ErrorExtension<MissingDataError>("missing data")
446  { }
447 };
448 
449 #define NotImplementedError(_func_) NotImplementedError(_func_, __FILE__, __LINE__)
450
